endpoints.description: Return basic information about the API

endpoints.name: /agents
endpoints.description: Return information about all available agents or a list of them

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma)

query.name: ip
query.description: Filter by the IP used by the agent to communicate with the manager. If it's not available, it will have the same value as registerIP

query.name: limit
query.description: Maximum number of elements to return

query.name: manager
query.description: Filter by manager hostname where agents are connected to

query.name: offset
query.description: First element to return in the collection

query.name: older_than
query.description: Filter out agents whose time lapse from last keep alive signal is longer than specified. Time in seconds, ‘[n_days]d’, ‘[n_hours]h’, ‘[n_minutes]m’ or ‘[n_seconds]s’. For never_connected agents, uses the register date. For example, `7d`, `10s` and `10` are valid values. When no time unit is specified, seconds are used.

query.name: q
query.description: Query to filter results by. For example q="status=active"

query.name: registerIP
query.description: Filter by the IP used when registering the agent

query.name: search
query.description:
Look for elements containing the specified string. To obtain a complementary search, use '-' at the
beggining

query.name: select
query.description: Select which fields to return (separated by comma). Use '.' for nested fields. For example, "{field1: field2}" may be selected with "field1.field2"

query.name: sort
query.description:
Sort the collection by a field or fields (separated by comma). Use +/- at the beggining to list in ascending or descending order.
Use '.' for nested fields. For example, "{field1: field2}" may be selected with "field1.field2"

query.name: status
query.description: Filter by agent status. Use commas to enter multiple statuses

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/config/:component/:configuration
endpoints.description: Return the active configuration the agent is currently using. This can be different from the configuration present in the configuration file, if it has been modified and the agent has not been restarted yet

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

args.name: :configuration
args.description:
Selected agent's configuration to read. The configuration to read depends on the selected component. The following table shows all available combinations of component and configuration values:

Component Configuration Tag
agent client <client>
agent buffer <client_buffer>
agent labels <labels>
agent internal agent, monitord, remoted
agentless agentless <agentless>
analysis global <global>
analysis active_response <active-response>
analysis alerts <alerts>
analysis command <command>
analysis rules <rule>
analysis decoders <decoder>
analysis internal analysisd
auth auth <auth>
com active-response <active-response>
com logging <logging>
com internal execd
com cluster cluster
csyslog csyslog <csyslog_output>
integrator integration <integration>
logcollector localfile <localfile>
logcollector socket <socket>
logcollector internal logcollector
mail global <global><email...>
mail alerts <email_alerts>
mail internal maild
monitor internal monitord
monitor internal reports
request remote <remote>
request internal remoted
syscheck syscheck <syscheck>
syscheck rootcheck <rootcheck>
syscheck internal syscheck, rootcheck
wmodules wmodules <wodle>

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/group/is_sync
endpoints.description: Return whether the agent configuration has been synchronized with the agent or not. This can be useful to check after updating a group configuration

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/key
endpoints.description: Return the key of an agent

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/upgrade_result
endpoints.description: Return the upgrade result after updating an agent

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

endpoints.name: /agents/no_group
endpoints.description: Return a list with all the available agents without group

endpoints.description: Return wazuh configuration used in node {node_id}

query.name: field
query.description: Indicate a section child. E.g, fields for *ruleset* section are: decoder_dir, rule_dir, etc

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/configuration/:component/:configuration
endpoints.description: Return the requested configuration in JSON format
endpoints.summary: Get active configuration in node node_id

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/files
endpoints.description: Return file contents from any file in cluster node {node_id}
endpoints.summary: Get file contents from a specified node in the cluster

query.name: path
query.description: Filepath to return file. (Relative to wazuh installation folder)

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/info
endpoints.description: Return basic information about a specified node such as version, compilation date, installation path

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/logs
endpoints.description: Return the last 2000 wazuh log entries in node {node_id}
endpoints.summary: Get a specified node's wazuh logs

query.name: limit
query.description: Maximum number of elements to return

query.name: offset
query.description: First element to return in the collection

query.name: q
query.description: Query to filter results by. For example q="status=active"

query.name: search
query.description:
Look for elements containing the specified string. To obtain a complementary search, use '-' at the
beggining

query.name: sort
query.description:
Sort the collection by a field or fields (separated by comma). Use +/- at the beggining to list in ascending or descending order.
Use '.' for nested fields. For example, "{field1: field2}" may be selected with "field1.field2"

query.name: tag
query.description: Wazuh component that logged the event

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/logs/summary
endpoints.description: Return a summary of the last 2000 wazuh log entries in node {node_id}
endpoints.summary: Get a summary of a specified node's wazuh logs

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats
endpoints.description: Return Wazuh statistical information in node {node_id} for the current or specified date

query.name: date
query.description: Date to obtain statistical information from. Format YYYY-MM-DD

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats/analysisd
endpoints.description: Return Wazuh analysisd statistical information in node {node_id}
endpoints.summary: Get a specified node's analysisd stats

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats/hourly
endpoints.description: Return Wazuh statistical information in node {node_id} per hour. Each number in the averages field represents the average of alerts per hour
endpoints.summary: Get a specified node's stats per hour

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats/remoted
endpoints.description: Return Wazuh remoted statistical information in node {node_id}
endpoints.summary: Get a specified node's remoted stats

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats/weekly
endpoints.description: Return Wazuh statistical information in node {node_id} per week. Each number in the averages field represents the average of alerts per hour for that specific day
endpoints.summary: Get a specified node's stats per week

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/status
endpoints.description: Return the status of all Wazuh daemons in node node_id

endpoints.name: /cluster/api/config
endpoints.description: Return the API configuration of all the selected nodes in JSON format
endpoints.summary: Get the API configuration of all nodes (or a list of them)

query.name: nodes_list
query.description: List of node IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /cluster/configuration/validation
endpoints.description: Return whether the Wazuh configuration is correct or not in all cluster nodes or a list of them

query.name: nodes_list
query.description: List of node IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /cluster/healthcheck
endpoints.description: Return cluster healthcheck information for all nodes or a list of them. Such information includes last keep alive, last synchronization time and number of agents reporting on each node

query.name: nodes_list
query.description: List of node IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /cluster/local/config
endpoints.description: Return the current node cluster configuration

endpoints.name: /cluster/local/info
endpoints.description: Return basic information about the cluster node receiving the request
endpoints.summary: Get information about the local node

endpoints.name: /cluster/nodes
endpoints.description: Get information about all nodes in the cluster or a list of them

endpoints.name: /manager/api/config
endpoints.description: Return the local API configuration in JSON format

endpoints.name: /manager/configuration
endpoints.description: Return wazuh configuration used

query.name: field
query.description: Indicate a section child. E.g, fields for *ruleset* section are: decoder_dir, rule_dir, etc

endpoints.name: /manager/configuration/:component/:configuration
endpoints.description: Return the requested configuration in JSON format
endpoints.summary: Get active configuration in manager for one component [on demand]

args.name: :configuration
args.description:
Selected agent's configuration to read. The configuration to read depends on the selected component. The following table shows all available combinations of component and configuration values:

Component Configuration Tag
agent client <client>
agent buffer <client_buffer>
agent labels <labels>
agent internal agent, monitord, remoted
agentless agentless <agentless>
analysis global <global>
analysis active_response <active-response>
analysis alerts <alerts>
analysis command <command>
analysis rules <rule>
analysis decoders <decoder>
analysis internal analysisd
auth auth <auth>
com active-response <active-response>
com logging <logging>
com internal execd
com cluster cluster
csyslog csyslog <csyslog_output>
integrator integration <integration>
logcollector localfile <localfile>
logcollector socket <socket>
logcollector internal logcollector
mail global <global><email...>
mail alerts <email_alerts>
mail internal maild
monitor internal monitord
monitor internal reports
request remote <remote>
request internal remoted
syscheck syscheck <syscheck>
syscheck rootcheck <rootcheck>
syscheck internal syscheck, rootcheck
wmodules wmodules <wodle>

endpoints.name: /manager/configuration/validation
endpoints.description: Return whether the Wazuh configuration is correct

endpoints.description: Return file contents from any file

query.name: use_http
query.description: Use http protocol. If it's false use https. By default the value is set to false

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/upgrade_custom
endpoints.description: Upgrade the agent using a local WPK file
endpoints.summary: Upgrade agent using a custom file

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

query.name: file_path
query.description: Full path to the WPK file. The file must be on a folder on the Wazuh's installation directory (by default, /var/ossec)

query.name: installer
query.description: Installation script. Default is upgrade.sh or upgrade.bat for windows agents

endpoints.name: /agents/group
endpoints.description: Assign all agents or a list of them to the specified group
endpoints.summary: Assign agents to a single group

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma)

query.name: force_single_group
query.description: Whether to append the new group to current agent's multigroup or replace it

endpoints.name: /agents/group/:group_id/restart
endpoints.description: Restart all agents which belong to a given group
endpoints.summary: Restart all agents in a group

endpoints.name: /agents/node/:node_id/restart
endpoints.description: Restart all agents which belong to a specific given node
endpoints.summary: Restart all agents which belong to a node

endpoints.name: /agents/restart
endpoints.description: Restart all agents or a list of them

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/files
endpoints.description: Replace file contents with the data contained in the API request in a specified cluster node
endpoints.summary: Updates file contents in a specified cluster node

query.name: overwrite
query.description: If set to false, an exception will be raised when updating contents of an already existing filename

query.name: path
query.description: Filepath to upload/delete file. (Relative to wazuh installation folder)

endpoints.name: /cluster/api/config
endpoints.description: Update the API configuration of all the selected nodes with the data contained in the API request
endpoints.summary: Update the API configuration of all nodes (or a list of them)

query.name: nodes_list
query.description: List of node IDs (separated by comma)

max_login_attempts.description: Maximum number of login attempts in {block_time} seconds

block_time.description: Blocking time for IPs that have exceeded {max_login_attempts}. Time counts from the first attempt

max_request_per_minute.description: Maximum number of requests allowed per minute

behind_proxy_server.description: Set this option to "yes" in case the API is running behind a proxy server.

source_route.description: Sources for which the resources will be available. For example 'http://client.example.org'

expose_headers.description: Which headers can be exposed as part of the response.

allow_headers.description: Which HTTP headers can be used during the actual request.

allow_credentials.description: Browsers will only expose the response to frontend JavaScript code if this is enabled.

use_only_authd.description: Force the use of authd when adding and removing agents.

endpoints.name: /cluster/restart
endpoints.description: Restart all nodes in the cluster or a list of them

query.name: nodes_list
query.description: List of node IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /groups/:group_id/configuration
endpoints.description: Update an specified group's configuration. This API call expects a full valid XML file with the shared configuration tags/syntax

endpoints.name: /manager/api/config
endpoints.description: Update local API configuration with the data contained in the API request

max_login_attempts.description: Maximum number of login attempts in {block_time} seconds

block_time.description: Blocking time for IPs that have exceeded {max_login_attempts}. Time counts from the first attempt

max_request_per_minute.description: Maximum number of requests allowed per minute

behind_proxy_server.description: Set this option to "yes" in case the API is running behind a proxy server.

source_route.description: Sources for which the resources will be available. For example 'http://client.example.org'

expose_headers.description: Which headers can be exposed as part of the response.

allow_headers.description: Which HTTP headers can be used during the actual request.

allow_credentials.description: Browsers will only expose the response to frontend JavaScript code if this is enabled.

use_only_authd.description: Force the use of authd when adding and removing agents.

endpoints.name: /manager/files
endpoints.description: Replace file contents with the data contained in the API request

query.name: overwrite
query.description: If set to false, an exception will be raised when updating contents of an already existing filename

query.name: path
query.description: Filepath to upload/delete file. (Relative to wazuh installation folder)

endpoints.name: /manager/restart
endpoints.description: Restart the wazuh manager

endpoints.name: /security/config
endpoints.description: Update the security configuration with the data contained in the API request

auth_token_exp_timeout.description: Time in seconds until the token expires

endpoints.name: /security/policies/:policy_id
endpoints.description: Modify a policy, at least one property must be indicated

policy.description: This is the definition of the new policy

actions.description: These are the actions that the policy performs

endpoints.name: /security/roles/:role_id
endpoints.description: Modify a role, cannot modify associated policies in this endpoint, at least one property must be indicated

endpoints.name: /security/rules/:rule_id
endpoints.description: Modify a security rule by specifying its ID

endpoints.name: /security/user/revoke
endpoints.description: This method should be called to revoke all JWT tokens

endpoints.name: /security/users/:user_id
endpoints.description: Modify a user's password by specifying their ID

endpoints.name: /syscheck
endpoints.description: Run syscheck in all agents
endpoints.summary: Run a syscheck scan in all agents

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /agents
endpoints.description: Add a new agent

body.name: force_time
body.description: Remove the old agent with the same IP if disconnected since <force_time> seconds

body.name: ip
body.description: If this is not included, the API will get the IP automatically. If you are behind a proxy, you must set the option behind_proxy_server to yes at api.yaml and make sure the proxy is setting HTTP header 'X-Forwarded-For' with origin IP address. Allowed values: IP, IP/NET, ANY

endpoints.name: /agents/insert
endpoints.description: Add an agent specifying its name, ID and IP. If an agent with the same ID already exists, replace it using `force` parameter
endpoints.summary: Add an agent specifying all its basic properties

body.name: force_time
body.description: Remove the old agent with the same IP if disconnected for <force_time> seconds

body.name: ip
body.description: If this is not included, the API will get the IP automatically. If you are behind a proxy, you must set the option behind_proxy_server to yes at api.yaml and make sure the proxy is setting HTTP header 'X-Forwarded-For' with origin IP address. Allowed values: IP, IP/NET, ANY

body.name: key
body.description: Key to use when communicating with the manager. The agent must have the same key on its `client.keys` file

endpoints.name: /agents/insert/quick
endpoints.description: Add a new agent with name `agent_name`. This agent will use `any` as IP

query.name: agent_name
query.description: Agent name used when the agent was registered

endpoints.name: /groups
endpoints.description: Create a new group

endpoints.name: /security/policies
endpoints.description: Add a new policy, all fields need to be specified

policy.description: This is the definition of the new policy

actions.description: These are the actions that the policy performs

endpoints.name: /security/roles
endpoints.description: Add a new role, all fields need to be specified
endpoints.summary: Add a new role to the system

endpoints.name: /security/roles/:role_id/policies
endpoints.description: Create a specified relation role-policy, one role may have multiples policies
endpoints.summary: Create a relation between one role and one or more policies

endpoints.name: /security/roles/:role_id/rules
endpoints.description: Create a specific role-rule relation. One role may have multiple security rules
endpoints.summary: Create a relation between one role and one or more security rules

query.name: rule_ids
query.description: List of rule IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /security/rules
endpoints.description: Add a new security rule
endpoints.summary: Add a new security rule to the system

endpoints.name: /security/user/authenticate/run_as
endpoints.description: This method should be called to get an API token using an authorization context body. This token will expire after auth_token_exp_timeout seconds (default: 3600). This value can be changed using PUT /security/config
endpoints.summary: Auth_context based authentication to get an access token

endpoints.name: /security/users
endpoints.description: Add a new user to the system through the API

endpoints.name: /security/users/:user_id/roles
endpoints.description: Create a specified relation role-policy, one user may have multiples roles
endpoints.summary: Create a specified relation between one user and one role

query.name: role_ids
query.description: List of role IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /agents
endpoints.description: Delete all agents or a list of them with optional criteria based on the status or time of the last connection

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all agents

query.name: older_than
query.description: Consider only agents whose last keep alive is older than the specified time frame. For never_connected agents, register date is considered instead of last keep alive. For example, `7d`, `10s` and `10` are valid values. When no time unit is specified, seconds are assumed. Default value: 7d

query.name: purge
query.description: Permanently delete an agent from the key store

query.name: status
query.description: Filter by agent status. Use commas to enter multiple statuses

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/group
endpoints.description: Remove the agent from all groups or a list of them. The agent will automatically revert to the "default" group if it is removed from all its assigned groups

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/group/:group_id
endpoints.description: Remove an agent from an specified group. If the agent has multigroups, it will preserve all previous groups except the last one
endpoints.summary: Remove an agent from a specific group

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

endpoints.name: /agents/group
endpoints.description: Remove all agents assignment or a list of them from the specified group
endpoints.summary: Remove agents assignment from a single group

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all agents

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/files
endpoints.description: Remove a specified file in the node {node-id}
endpoints.summary: Removes a file in a specified cluster node

query.name: path
query.description: Filepath to upload/delete file. (Relative to wazuh installation folder)

endpoints.description: Replace the API configuration of all the selected nodes with the default one
endpoints.summary: Restore the default API configuration of all nodes (or a list of them)

query.name: nodes_list
query.description: List of node IDs (separated by comma)
